qas.question: What game accessory was similar to the NES Zapper?
What game accessory was similar to the NES Advantage?
What game used the SNES Mouse?
What type of accessory was the Super Scope?
What game came with a baseball bat controller?
What was released that added to the Hudson Soft functionality?
What adjustable settings did the Super Scope have on its joystick?
What mulit player adapter did Super Scope release under its license from Nintendo?
What was the BatterUP baseball bat similar to?
What game was the NES Zapper released in conjunction with?

context: Throughout the course of its life, <b5_0>a number of peripherals<b5_0/> were released which added to the functionality of the SNES. Many of these devices were modeled after earlier add-ons for the NES: the <a0_0>Super Scope<a0_0/> is a <a3_0>light gun<a3_0/> functionally similar to <b8_0>the NES Zapper<b8_0/> (though the Super Scope features wireless capabilities) and the <a1_0>Super Advantage<a1_0/> is an arcade-style joystick with adjustable <b6_0>turbo settings<b6_0/> akin to the NES Advantage. Nintendo also released the SNES Mouse in conjunction with its <a2_0><b9_0>Mario Paint<b9_0/><a2_0/> title. Hudson Soft, under license from Nintendo, released <b7_0>the Super Multitap<b7_0/>, a multiplayer adapter for use with its popular series of Bomberman games. Some of the more unusual controllers include the <a4_0>BatterUP<a4_0/> baseball bat, the Life Fitness Entertainment System (an exercise bike controller with built-in monitoring software), and the TeeV Golf golf club.
